author: bridge-bot
content:
<nicoserranop> Guys! I have a problem with double signing:

1. User logs in to the sequencer using SIWE (it lets him use WalletConnect (with different wallets including Metamask if installed as an extension), Portis, Torus, Fortmatic and Coinbase Wallet).

2. User has to EIP-712 sign his potPubkeys with the same wallet as the one used to sign in. The problem here is that so far the only wallet that supports EIP-712 (eth_signTypedData_v4) is Metamask and Portis. Fortmatic and Exodus in WalletConnect are discarded. I am trying to make it work with Torus and Coinbase.



Solutions:

1. I was thinking that there might be a way to build the EIP-712 message and sign it using eth_sign which is a bit more generic and would have broader support from non-Metamask wallets. Do you think it is a good idea?

2. <@293496799854067712> suggested to put a message stating: "The following wallets are supported because they have the EIP-712 signature feature" right before the SIWE to the sequencer. That way users would know what to use.

3. Could we allow participants to upload their contribution without EIP-712? Just like we are doing with the Github contributions?


*MEGA UPDATE: I got it working except with some WalletConnect desktop wallets. Fortmatic, Portis, Torus, Coinbase, Metamask and WalletConnect QR scanned*
